Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photograph of Hillary Clinton featured a Confederate battle flag in the background.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the presence of a Confederate battle flag in the photograph.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating biases in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by suggesting that the photograph may be real before providing evidence that it has been doctored.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to support the existence of a Confederate battle flag in the photograph.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the photograph is authentic and not digitally manipulated.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim acknowledges the existence of an alternative explanation, which is that the image was digitally manipulated to include the Confederate battle flag.
